clinical_study.brief_title: Chloroquine Diphosphate in the Prevention of SARS in Covid-19 Infection
clinical_study.official_title: Phase IIb Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Chloroquine Diphosphate in the Treatment of Patients With Comorbidities, Without Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome, Under the New Coronavirus (SARS-CoV2): a Double-blind, Randomized, Placebo-controlled Clinical Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: Fundação de Medicina Tropical Dr. Heitor Vieira Dourado

clinical_study.source: Fundação de Medicina Tropical Dr. Heitor Vieira Dourado

brief_summary.textblock:
This is a double-blind, randomized, placebo-controlled clinical trial. A total of 210
      individuals aged over 18 years old, without a diagnosis of severe respiratory disease, who
      came to the study site with clinical and radiological suspicion of SARS-CoV2, will be
      randomized into two treatment groups at a 1:1 ratio to receive a 5-day CQ diphosphate tablets
      or placebo (tablet without active ingredient produced with the same physical
      characteristics).

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients with onset of severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS)
primary_outcome.description: Evaluate if CQ diphosphate prevents the onset of SARS in patients on intervention group through standardized questionnaires.

secondary_outcome.description: Mortality rate between intervention and placebo group on days 7, 14, and 28 after randomization

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants in need of intensive care support
secondary_outcome.time_frame: during and after intervention, up to 28 days
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of participants in need and duration of intensive care support after randomization
Viral load change in blood and oropharyngeal swab samples

secondary_outcome.measure: Cumulative incidence of serious adverse events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During and after intervention, up to 28 days
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of serious adverse events during and after treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Cumulative incidence of grade 3 and 4 adverse events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During and after intervention, up to 28 days
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of grade 3 and 4 adverse events during and after treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients with discontinued treatment
secondary_outcome.description: proportion of discontinuation or temporary suspension of treatment (for any reason)
proportion of patients with increased levels of troponin I
proportion and magnitude of QTcF interval increases higher than 500ms
Changes measured on day 120 will be compared to baseline, through spirometry.

arm_group.description: CQ 450mg twice daily (3 tablets of 150mg, every 12 hours) on day 1, followed by CQ 450mg once daily (3 tablets of 150mg) from D2 to D5. Oral administration.
Placebo tables of equal characteristics and duration of treatment.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          1. Suspected cases of COVID-19, due to clinical and radiological data, during the
             epidemic;

          2. Adult aged 18 or over, at the time of inclusion

          3. Not having severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS), that is, not using mechanical
             ventilation or supplemental oxygen, peripheral oxygen saturation> 94% in room air, and
             having a respiratory rate below 24 incursions per minute.

          4. Patients with comorbidities only, due to the increased risk of developing SARS

        Exclusion Criteria:

        1. Patients with chronic use of drugs known to prolong QTc interval.
